channel.title: Do you think it's possible?
channel.description: Well the thing is that i've been taking antibiotics for around 3 months and i have like 3 days more however, like 2 days ago i felt like i was getting sick from my throat, but just a bit, it didn't hurt, it just feels weird.. But do you think that somone can get sick(Getting cold, catching flu or idk) when taking antibiotics?

item.title: Do you think it's possible?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

This is not a medical forum, you should be asking this question on a suitable forum. Or better yet, go and ask your doctor.

I don’t know if you can become sick while taking them, but I do know that you shouldn’t take antibiotics for something that is not a bacterial infection.

Read full topic

item.title: Do you think it's possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Those who said no;

You can’t, get sick. But sometimes you can feel sick from the medicine/your body building an immunity. But it would’ve happened in early stages of taking the antibiotic. It also depends what you’re taking the antibiotic for. It sounds like you’re just getting a small cold, nothing to worry about. But you never know, look up the antibiotic on Google and find some messages boards about it. See if some of the common symptoms are sore throats or feeling sick.

Read full topic

item.title: Do you think it's possible?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

This is the board you are looking for. Your question isn’t intellectual on any level, but since I’m here:

No, you can’t catch viruses in your system from taking antibiotics, but the antibiotics can have side-effects, much like the ones you are having.

Read full topic
